oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-12-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 16, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Ford Rush, the Stacey Sisters (Nola and Marie), Jack Shook, and Elbert McEwen. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with an excerpt of a previous Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: DeFord Bailey; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Stacey Sisters; Jack Shook; Elbert McEwen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces DeFord Bailey -- Santa Don't You Stump Your Toe (DeFord Bailey) (incomplete) -- Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Flop-Eared Mule (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- When The Red, Red Robin Comes Bob, Bob, Bobbin' Along (Ford Rush) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Late Last Night When My Willie Came Home (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Soldier's Joy (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces the Stacey Sisters with Jack Shook and Elbert McEwen -- Ridin' Down The Canyon (Stacey Sisters, Jack Shook, Elbert McEwen) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Old Age Pension Check (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys)
